author: Ivan Petrov
title: Grand Tournament in Tokyo: Modern Horizons 3 Preview
publication_text:
The Magic: The Gathering community is buzzing with excitement as Wizards of the Coast announces the first major Modern Horizons 3 tournament in Tokyo, Japan. This event will feature exclusive preview cards and a $100,000 prize pool.

Top players from around the world, including reigning champion Yuta Takahashi, are expected to compete. The tournament will follow a Swiss-system format, with the top 8 advancing to a single-elimination bracket. Side events include Commander pods and Limited drafts with the new set.

Spectators can enjoy live commentary from Hall of Famers and special artist signings. Don’t miss this chance to see the future of Modern unfold!

author: Anna Smirnova
title: European Championship: Return to Barcelona
publication_text:
Barcelona will host the 2023 European Championship, marking the return of premier MTG events to Spain after a five-year hiatus. The tournament will feature Standard, Pioneer, and Limited formats across three days of intense competition.

With over 500 players expected, this event will be a key qualifier for the Pro Tour. Local game stores are running Last Chance Qualifiers in the weeks leading up to the championship. The venue, Fira de Barcelona, will also host a massive MagicFest with on-demand events and exclusive merchandise.

Highlights include a cosplay contest and a charity auction for original card art. Whether you’re competing or watching, this is a can’t-miss event for European Magic fans!

author: Dmitry Ivanov
title: Las Vegas Open: The Biggest Commander Event of the Year
publication_text:
The annual Las Vegas Open is expanding to include the world’s largest Commander tournament, with a $50,000 prize pool dedicated solely to Magic’s most popular casual format.

This year’s event introduces a revolutionary tournament structure: players will compete in pods of four, with points awarded for political plays, creative deckbuilding, and sportsmanship. The judging panel includes Command Zone hosts Jimmy Wong and Josh Lee Kwai.

Beyond the main event, attendees can enjoy:
- A 24-hour gaming hall
- VIP meet-and-greets with Magic celebrities
- A 'Build-a-Deck' challenge with random card pools
Early bird registration opens next month – start brewing your most inventive decks now!

author: Elena Kuznetsova
title: Sydney Team Trios: Unified Modern Returns
publication_text:
Australia’s premier Magic event is back with a twist – the Sydney Team Trios will feature Unified Modern, where teams of three share a single card pool across their decks.

This challenging format requires perfect coordination and deckbuilding creativity. Past champions have described it as 'the ultimate test of team synergy.' The tournament will be held at the iconic International Convention Centre Sydney, with stunning harbor views.

New for 2023:
- Junior division for players under 18
- Streamed feature matches with local commentary
- Special 'Aussie Rules' side events with unique deck restrictions
Qualifiers are running now at participating stores across Oceania.

author: Alexey Morozov
title: Moscow Vintage Championship: Power Nine Unleashed
publication_text:
The most prestigious Vintage tournament in Eastern Europe returns to Moscow’s Crocus Expo Center, with sanctioned Power Nine play for the first time since 2019.

This invitation-only event will gather 64 of the world’s top Vintage specialists competing for a Black Lotus trophy and a complete set of Beta dual lands. The tournament coincides with Russia’s first official Magic museum exhibit, featuring rare prototypes and original artwork.

Event highlights include:
- Workshops on old-school deckbuilding
- A 'Reserved List Gauntlet' side event
- Live restoration demonstrations of damaged collectibles
Spectator tickets are extremely limited – secure yours today!

author: Olga Vasnetsova
title: Cairo Pro Tour: Pioneer in the Pyramids
publication_text:
Magic makes history with the first Pro Tour held in Africa, set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Giza plateau. The Pioneer format takes center stage in this landmark event.

Wizards of the Coast is partnering with Egyptian tourism authorities to create an unforgettable experience. The main tournament hall will be a custom-built structure near the Sphinx, while evening events include:
- A 'Pharaoh’s Draft' with Egypt-themed alters
- Hieroglyphic card translation workshops
- A desert-themed Commander night under the stars

Local players can qualify through a special tournament series at Nile Valley game stores. This is Magic culture meeting ancient history!

author: Sergey Lebedev
title: Rio de Janeiro Street Magic Championship
publication_text:
Magic meets carnival spirit in Brazil’s first open-air championship, transforming Copacabana Beach into a massive gaming arena.

This experimental tournament breaks all conventions:
- Matches played on custom beach playmats
- Decks must include at least 20 cards from Brazilian sets
- 'Samba Clock' replaces traditional rounds

The event will feature live music, food stalls, and a special 'Favela Gauntlet' where local players challenge pros. Winners receive a unique trophy containing sand from Copacabana and a sheet of uncut Portuguese cards.

Registration is open to all – just bring your deck and sunscreen!

author: Maria Sokolova
title: Ice Crown Tournament: Arctic Commander Showdown
publication_text:
In the most extreme Magic event ever conceived, 100 players will battle in glass igloos under the Northern Lights in Finnish Lapland.

This Commander tournament features special rules:
- 'Frozen Mana' – tap a basic land three times and it becomes snow-covered
- 'Aurora Borealis' – random global effects every hour
- 'Blizzard Draft' – build decks while wearing mittens

Participants will stay in an ice hotel and enjoy husky sledding between rounds. The winner receives a one-of-a-kind ice sculpture of their commander and a complete set of snow-covered basics.

Thermal playmats and hot beverage stations provided!

author: Pavel Novikov
title: Dubai Mythic Championship: Golden Ticket Event
publication_text:
The Burj Khalifa’s observation deck will host Magic’s most luxurious tournament, where the entry fee includes a stay at the 7-star Burj Al Arab.

This exclusive event features:
- Solid gold life counters
- Matches played on diamond-dusted playmats
- A concierge service to fetch cards from your collection

The tournament coincides with the unveiling of special Arabian Nights reprints with Arabic script. First prize includes a week on a private island and a Black Lotus graded by all major services.

Qualification is through a series of high-stakes auctions – because in Dubai, even Magic has a different scale!

author: Alina Kovaleva
title: Antarctic Research Station Tournament: Magic at the End of the World
publication_text:
Scientists and Magic enthusiasts stationed in Antarctica will compete in the world’s southernmost tournament at McMurdo Station.

This unique event has special challenges:
- Decks must be built from a shared pool of 10,000 cards air-dropped for the event
- Matches paused for aurora sightings
- 'Blind Mulligan' rule due to constant daylight

The tournament will be streamed globally to raise awareness about climate research. Participants will sign special ice-proof cards that will later be auctioned for charity.

Wizards has created a commemorative snow land set just for this event – because even at -40°C, the Magic must go on!
